title: High-Resolution Groundwater Storage Monitoring using Multi-Model Machine Learning
description: Development of a machine learning framework combining Random Forest and deep learning models to downscale GRACE satellite data for groundwater monitoring across the Mississippi River Basin.
funding: ORISE Fellowship - U.S. Department of Defense

title: Precipitation Temporal Disaggregation for Event-Based Hydrological Modeling
description: A study aimed at disaggregating daily satellite precipitation data into sub-daily scales to support flood modeling and hydrological event analysis in the Kathmandu Watershed, Nepal.
funding: ORISE Fellowship - U.S. Department of Defense

title: Soil Moisture Dataset Comparison for Hydrological Applications
description: Comparison of various soil moisture products to evaluate consistency, biases, and suitability for hydrological modeling and drought monitoring.

title: Urban Climate Mitigation using WRF-Urban Modeling
description: Using WRF-Urban to evaluate urban heat mitigation strategies such as rooftop farming, reflective surfaces, and solar panel installations in urban areas.

title: Wildfire Watershed Clustering and Change Detection
description: Clustering watersheds based on fire event characteristics and analyzing post-fire changes in landscape and hydrological response.

title: Compound Hazard Risk Assessment in Coastal Areas
description: Evaluation of compound climate hazards involving storm surge and extreme precipitation using advanced statistical approaches including copulas and Bayesian modeling.
publications: Evaluating the Compound Effects of Precipitation and Storm Surge on Coastal Flooding Risk
funding: ORISE Fellowship - U.S. Department of Defense

title: GeoClimate Workshop Tool Development
description: Development of a workshop framework and open-source tools for climate data acquisition, index calculation, and validation, featuring GeoClimate-Fetcher, Index-Visualizer, and GeeData-GroundData-Validator.

title: Cooling Effects of Blue-Green Spaces in Kathmandu Valley
description: Quantified the temperature reduction potential of urban blue-green infrastructure (ponds, parks, forests) in the Kathmandu Valley using satellite-derived surface temperature data.
publications: Bhattarai, S., et al. (2025). Quantifying the cooling effects of blue-green spaces across urban landscapes: A case study of Kathmandu Valley, Nepal. *Urban Climate*, 61, 102493. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.uclim.2025.102493

title: Spatiotemporal Heatwave Projections Across US Cities
description: Used climate model projections and statistical tools to understand spatial and temporal variability of heatwaves across major US cities.
publications: Bhattarai, S., et al. (2025). Understanding spatiotemporal variation of heatwave projections across US cities. *Scientific Reports*, 15, 10643. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-025-95097-5

title: Projected Changes in Precipitation Extremes Using NEX-GDDP-CMIP6
description: Analyzed changes in precipitation extremes across the Mississippi River Basin using downscaled NASA CMIP6 datasets, evaluating trends under different climate scenarios.
publications: Talchabhadel, R., Bhattarai, S., Bista, S. (2024). Projected Changes in Precipitation Extremes Across the Mississippi River Basin. *International Journal of Climatology*. https://doi.org/10.1002/joc.8748

title: Heatwave Exposure in Vulnerable Communities
description: Explored the spatial patterns and temporal dynamics of heatwave exposure across socioeconomically vulnerable populations in the U.S.
publications: Bhattarai, S., et al. (2024). Spatiotemporal Characterization of Heatwave Exposure across Historically Vulnerable Communities. *Scientific Reports*. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-024-71704-9

title: Comparative Analysis of Satellite-Based Precipitation Products
description: Conducted a comparative analysis of satellite-based precipitation products over the Continental U.S. and Hawaii to determine the most reliable dataset for hydrological modeling.
publications: Bhattarai, S., Talchabhadel, R. (2024). Comparative Analysis of Satellite-Based Precipitation Data across the CONUS and Hawaii. *Remote Sensing*, 16(16), 3058. https://doi.org/10.3390/rs16163058

title: Urban Heatwave Characterization Using Satellite Data
description: Used satellite-based land surface temperature data to assess urban heatwave dynamics and land cover influences in an urban center.
publications: Banjara, P., Bhattarai, S., Pandey, V.P. et al. (2024). Spatiotemporal characterization of heatwaves on an urban center using satellite-based estimates. *Theoretical and Applied Climatology*. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00704-024-05026-1

title: Hydro-Climatic Extremes in Western Nepal
description: Projected hydro-climatic extremes in Western Nepal using CMIP6 models, focusing on rainfall variability and climate risks for rain-fed river basins.
publications: Bhattarai, T.N., et al. (2022). Projected changes in hydro-climatic extremes with CMIP6 climate model outputs. *Stochastic Environmental Research and Risk Assessment*. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00477-022-02312-0
